title: Rosedale Chimney Bank Walking Route

images.title: SMJ / Calcining Kilns at Rosedale Chimney Bank
images.caption: Calcining Kilns at Rosedale Chimney Bank

images.title: Mick Garratt / Western View of the Former Miners' Cottages
images.caption: Western View of the Former Miners' Cottages. Originally comprising sixteen cottages they were abandoned in 1966 but the remaining ones have since been renovated. One was in use as a youth hostel between 1933 to 1950.

images.title: colin grice, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rosedale Chimney Bank. This hill on the road to Hutton-le-Hole is notoriously steep. It's been used in the past for competitive hill-climb events. On the first weekend in September a local vintage car club run their vehicles up the hill - some of the less powerful ones do struggle with the gradient which is said to exceed 1 in 3.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Seat with a View Across Rosedale
images.caption: Seat with a View Across Rosedale

images.title: Car park at Bank Top by Pauline E, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A view of the Car park at Bank Top where you can start your walk.

images.title: Rosedale Chimney Bank, North Yorkshire Moors, Yorkshire by Christine Matthews, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pretty purple heather in August.

description: This circular walk visits the wonderful old kilns at Rosedale Chimney Bank near Rosedale Abbey on the North York Moors. The walk can be started from the car park just south of Rosedale Abbey at Bank Top. You can then pick up trails around the impressive Bank Top Kilns. The huge photogenic kilns are a remnant of the site's 19th century ironstone industry. The on site information board provides more detail on the Victorian history of the area. There's also some fantastic views over the surrounding North York Moors from the elevated position of the kilns. Look out for lovely heather during the late summer months too. The area is also popular with cyclists because of the steep gradient of the hill. It is often referred to as the 'chain braker'. To continue your walking in the area head north and pick up the Rosedale Abbey Walk .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: From the car park you can also pick up the Rosedale Railway Walk. This will take you along the elevated Mineral Railway, visiting some of the heritage mines on the way.

display_address: Rosedale Chimney Bank, Spaunton, Rosedale Abbey, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, YO18 8SE, United Kingdom
